concise_definition: n. 政策, 方针, 保险单

definitions.explanation_en: A set of principles, guidelines, or rules established by an organization, government, or authority to guide decisions and achieve specific goals.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指由组织、政府或权威机构制定的一套原则、指导方针或规则，用以引导决策并实现特定目标。
definitions.example_en: The government introduced a new environmental policy to reduce carbon emissions.
definitions.example_cn: 政府出台了一项新的环境政策，以减少碳排放。

definitions.explanation_en: A formal contract between an insurance company and a policyholder, outlining the terms under which the company will provide financial protection against specified risks.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指保险公司与投保人之间签订的正式合同，明确在特定风险发生时保险公司提供经济保障的条款。
definitions.example_en: She filed a claim after her car accident, as her auto insurance policy covered collision damage.
definitions.example_cn: 她在发生车祸后提出了索赔，因为她的汽车保险单涵盖了碰撞损失。

definitions.explanation_en: A course of action or strategy adopted by an individual or group, especially in response to a particular situation or problem.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指个人或群体为应对特定情况或问题而采取的行动方案或策略。
definitions.example_en: His policy of always arriving early has earned him a reputation for reliability.
definitions.example_cn: 他总是提前到达的策略使他赢得了可靠的好名声。

comparison.analysis: “Rule”（规则）通常指具体、明确、强制性的行为规范，具有较高的约束力和可执行性，常用于日常管理或法律条文。而 “policy” 更偏向于宏观指导原则，具有灵活性和方向性，不一定具有强制执行力。
“Procedure”（程序/流程）强调完成某项任务的具体步骤或操作顺序，是执行政策或规则时的实施方法。而 “policy” 是决定‘做什么’，而 ‘procedure’ 是说明‘怎么做’。
“Doctrine”（教义/信条）通常用于宗教、政治或意识形态领域，指一套系统化、长期稳定且具有哲学或信仰基础的原则。它比 “policy” 更抽象、更根本，且不易更改。而 “policy” 更具实用性和可调整性，常随环境变化而更新。
